answers.a: E317 (erythorbin/erythorbic acid) is a food antioxidant that slows oxidation to help preserve color and flavor in products; it’s unrelated to cameras.

answers.q: hp camera photo smart e317 is how old
answers.a: E317 is a food additive code, not a camera; erythorbic acid has been used in foods since the mid-20th century and is approved by many regulators (e.g., EU E-number system, FDA GRAS).

answers.q: what paint company uses code e317
answers.a: E317 is the EU code for erythorbin/erythorbic acid, a food antioxidant—not a paint code; it’s used by food manufacturers in items like processed meats and canned foods to prevent oxidation.
